label: Description
value: Frieze on off-white ground,metallic gold feathered c-scrolls encircled by tan and brown roses and green leafy stems; at the bottom arching sprigs of green leaves and tiny gold flowers.

label: Description
value: On patterned orange and metallic gold ground, dark brown stencil technique delineates all-over patterns stylized floral and foliage.

label: Description
value: Frieze on patterned red ground, to the apearance of swagged velvet fabric or drapery gathered at the top by gold metallic fasterners; metallic gold and white torch-motif patterns bordered at the bottom by scalloped metallic gold patterned swags.

label: Description
value: On tan ground, alternating brown and off-white rose bouquet within "c"-scroll medallions of white and yellow mica.

label: Description
value: Floral medallions enclosed within diaper pattern formed with scrolls and foliate sprigs. Printed in salmon, green, ocher and metallic gold on beige ground. Printed in selvedge: "Benton, Heath & Co. 1076".

label: Description
value: One motif visible in a large-scale yellow damask with a symmetrical design or mirror image on the center line of an elaborate exotic plant form with long slender leaves.

label: Description
value: Part of a border, probably for a dress, with a main section composed of vertical lancet leaves alternating with a floral sprig. Every third sprig is the stem for a large exotic flower reaching up into the field. Narrow lower band a repeat of small rosettes and short bands. Colors are predominantly green, tan and brown on a natural linen ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: long floating satin stitch and applique on plain weave

label: Description
value: Part of a multicolored border with a main section of repeating triangles and arches. The arches frame a landscape of grass and trees, and the main triangle supports an oval medallion framing Cupid. Probably part of a border for a dress.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk, net, metallic thread, metal sequins Technique: couching and satin stitches and applique on plain weave

label: Description
value: One rose-tan repeat of a symmetrical pattern (mirror image on the center line) of superimposed ogee trellis with leaves, fruit and acorns.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 52 x 55.5 cm (20 1/2 x 21 7/8 in.) Repeat H: 39.4 cm (15 1/2 in.)

label: Description
value: Two fragments of an allover pattern of brackets, arches, scrolls and flowers. Metallic yarns on a cream damask ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns Technique: compound of plain weave and 8-harness satin weave, with discontinuous supplementary wefts either free-floating or bound in 3/1 twill

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1973:  Josephine Howell collection; 1973: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Patchwork quilt with a stepped squared diamond pattern in ivory, red and green. The ivory fabric forming the stepped diamond is plain. The red and green fabrics forming the lattice and borders are patterned by tiny flowers. The back is red with green edge.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: pieced and sewn patchwork of plain and roller-printed fabrics, quilted

label: Description
value: Patchwork cover made from a variety of woven fabrics and ribbons. Diamond shape in the center with a triangle on each side to form a central square surrounded by twelve squares plus an outer border. Each square contains an embroidered naturalistic flower.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: embroidered on patchwork of woven fabric and ribbons

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Arthur Stanbury; 1973: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Vertical pattern of continuously curving branches supporting flowers and leaves printed on ivory ground in yellow, red, green, blue, and black on a blue background patterned with red microdots. A complex sequence of printing and dyeing techniques, including resist printing and immersion dyeing were used to create this densely patterned textile.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 84 x 62 cm (33 1/16 x 24 7/16 in.) Repeat H x W: 31.8 x 14 cm (12 1/2 x 5 1/2 in.)

label: Notes
value: Vertical pattern of continuously curving branches supporting flowers and leaves printed on ivory ground in yellow, red, green, blue, and black on a blue background patterned with red microdots. A complex sequence of printing and dyeing techniques, including resist printing and immersion dyeing were used to create this densely patterned textile.

label: Description
value: Repeat of the same horizontal band with two large peacocks and other smaller birds among flowers. The background is deep red-purple – the overall color effect is heavy and dark.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: roller printed on plain weave, glazed

label: Description
value: Multicolored pillar print with a single fluted column and capitals of scrolling flower and vine motif in a symmetrical arrangement. Capitals are festooned with flowers like roses and tulips.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton (?) Technique: printed by relief and engraved roller on plain weave

label: Description
value: "Candlewick" bedcover of cotton muslin embroidered in knotted stitches in cotton. Bordered on three sides with off-white cotton fringe.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Four fragments of a larger design of exotic blossoms, tree trunks, and birds on a white ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: mordants for reds, purples, black and browns applied by pen and brush (sometimes over resist); blue applied over resist; yellow applied over blue (chintz) on plain weave

label: Description
value: Fragment from a larger panel. Design of flowers springing from decorative shapes.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: mordants for 2 reds, 2 purples and black applied over resist; madder dyed; blue applied over resist by immersion; yellow applied by brush, (chintz) on plain weave

value: Warp x Weft: 56 x 22 cm (22 1/16 x 8 11/16 in.)

value: White pattern on a blue background. Vertically symmetrical pattern of swags gathered together with flowers and a tassel to form a grid enclosing two branches, each with a bird.

value: Medium: linen warp, cotton weft Technique: block printed with a resist medium on plain weave foundation; immersion dyed in blue

value: Warp x Weft: 60.5 x 27 cm (23 13/16 x 10 5/8 in.) Repeat H: 26 cm (10 1/4 in.)

value: Bunch of flowers enclosed by a thin wreath and a ribbon tied to an oval frame showing a parrot on a perch. Picotage background.
